lead_paragraph: CAPPIELLO--Frank A.,Jr., 90, of Baltimore, MD, was born on January 5, 1926 and died on March 19, 2016. He is survived by his wife of 61 years, Marie Rhodes Cappiello; son Frank R. Cappiello; daughters Annmarie C. Graham (Tim) and Elaine C. Sutton (Trib); grandchildren Robert and Will Graham and Jack and Rahily Sutton; and sister Theresa C. Castellano. He was preceded in death by his brother, William E. Cappiello. He was born and raised in Trenton, NJ. He was a graduate of Notre Dame University and Harvard Business School. He served in the United States Navy in World War II and the United States Marine Corps in Korea. He was awarded the Navy Combat Action Ribbon. He began his professional career at Virginia Electric and Power Company (VEPCO) in Richmond, VA. He was an analyst and then Research Director at the brokerage firm Alex. Brown & Sons in Baltimore, MD. He was Chief Investment Officer at Monumental Life Insurance Co. in Baltimore, MD. For over 30 years, he was a principal of several investment advisory firms and funds, most recently with Montgomery Brothers, Cappiello, LLC. From 1970-2002 he was a regular panelist and occasional host on the PBS program Wall Street Week. He was a frequent speaker for Fortune 500 companies and academic institutions. He was the author of four investment books. A Funeral Mass will be offered on Wednesday, March 23rd at 11am at the Cathedral of Mary Our Queen, 5200 N. Charles St., Baltimore, MD. In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions in his name may be made to Loyola Preschool Fund, C/O Fr. Watters, St. Ignatius Church, 740 N. Calvert St., Baltimore, MD 21202 or Gilchrist Hospice Care, 11311 McCormick Rd., Suite 350, Hunt Valley, MD 21031. 1/3
